page.title: 13SHOTLEY BRIDGE HOSPITAL
page.content: Shotley Bridge Hospital was built between 1912-1914 on the site of a mental hospital called "Whinney Farm". It now covers 17 hectares. During the war the patients were wounded soldiers and the hospital became famous for it's plastic surgery.With the development of the National Health Service in 1948 it became Shotley Bridge General Hospital.It pioneered open heart surgery but this work is continued in a Newcastle hospital now.The hospital's annual budget is over Â£14 million.It has 23 wards and 486 beds and employs about 1200 people.A computer is being installed for record Keeping and computers do the wages.In the new Orthopaedic Theatre the air is 200 times cleaner than in other theatres.Many cleaners,kitchen and laundry staff may loose(cont.
